intro: Rumohra lurida, commonly known as the slender wall-rush, is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. The plant has slender, grass-like stems and small, triangular leaves that are often densely packed. Its flowers are clustered in spikelets, and it produces small, wind-pollinated flowers that are inconspicuous. Rumohra lurida plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
